title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 4)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Abington home at 89 Andrew Ford Way, built in 1947 with 3 bedrooms, sold for $720,000.
Andover's 2 Nollet Drive, a 1992 Colonial with 4,060 sq ft, sold for $1,849,000.
Boston condo at 1 Dalton St. #5503, built in 2015 with 2 bedrooms, sold for $9,500,000.

title: Manhole fires on Newbury Street prompt building and street evacuations
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Six manholes exploded on Newbury Street, prompting street closures and evacuations from Gloucester to Dartmouth Street.
Boston Police and Fire Departments responded to manhole fires, likely caused by an electrical issue, with no injuries reported.
Streets closed include Newbury between Exeter and Clarendon, and Dartmouth and Exeter between Boylston and Commonwealth.

title: South Station’s new fare gates still out of service more than a week after snow storm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: South Station's new fare gates have been out of service since a major snowstorm hit Boston over a week ago.
Large snow accumulations in the concourse area led to the gates being shut down and covered for protection.
The fare gates, costing $1.3 million, have been in place for just a month before the storm-related shutdown.

title: Devin McCourty on ’25 Patriots: ‘A lot different than us’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Devin McCourty praises the 2025 Patriots' mentality, highlighting their belief that they can beat any opponent.
Mike Vrabel downplays past Patriots dynasties, emphasizing this year's team's unique achievements and program-building efforts.
The current Patriots team, led by MVP candidate Drake Maye, prepares for Super Bowl LX with a renewed, focused approach.

title: Woman who posed as student at Boston high schools accepts plea deal, sentenced to probation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Shelby Hewitt, 34, from Canton, pleaded guilty to five charges including forgery and identity fraud at Suffolk Superior Court.
Hewitt was sentenced to four years of probation, ordered to pay over $9,000 in restitution, and to avoid Boston Public Schools.
Hewitt's plea deal dismissed additional charges like larceny; she used aliases to enroll in three high schools during 2022-2023.

title: BPS pauses new hiring amid deficit as district predicts hundreds of layoffs next year
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Public Schools announces a partial hiring freeze due to a projected $53 million budget deficit.
Three schools slated for closure by 2027 could lead to 300-400 teacher and paraprofessional job cuts.
Budget deficit driven by rising health insurance, transportation, and special education costs, per BPS financial officers.

title: From SNL-style ‘Weekend Updates’ to a TD Garden beer chug, Will Campbell isn’t afraid to bring the laughs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell performs SNL-style 'Weekend Updates' for Patriots to bring humor to team film sessions.
Campbell went viral for a beer chug at a Celtics game, celebrated by teammates and fans.
Drake Maye selects Campbell as top choice for Sports Illustrated swimsuit model among Patriots players.

title: Police searching for Dorchester girl missing since Thursday
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Mela Rosario, 17, from Dorchester, is missing since January 29, last seen near Brockton courthouse after a family court appearance.
Rosario is described as 5’1” with brown skin, brown eyes, and brown hair with a blonde streak, last seen in a pink jacket.
Boston Police urge anyone with information on Rosario's whereabouts to contact the District C-11 Detectives or BPD at (617) 343-4335.

title: Devin McCourty explains ‘travesty’ following Belichick, Kraft Hall-of-Fame snubs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft were not selected for the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
Devin McCourty criticized the Hall of Fame voting process, considering Belichick and Kraft obvious choices for enshrinement.
Kraft had been on the ballot since 2013 and advanced to the finalist stage for the first time in 2026.

title: Celtics reportedly trade Anfernee Simons to Bulls, acquire Nikola Vučević
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics trade Anfernee Simons and a second-round pick to Bulls for Nikola Vučević and a second-round pick.
Nikola Vučević's salary is $6.2 million less than Anfernee Simons' $27.7 million, aiding Celtics' luxury tax reduction.
Vučević has averaged 16.9 points and 9.0 rebounds this season, strengthening Boston's frontcourt with needed scoring and rebounding.
